meanings.definition: To make someone feel welcome and included.
meanings.sent1: The teacher always tries to enrace new students in the classroom.
meanings.sent2: The community event aimed to enrace all members of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The party host made sure to enrace every guest with a warm smile.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness enraced everyone like a cozy blanket on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The organization's mission is to enrace individuals from all walks of life.

meanings.definition: To incorporate or blend different cultures or races.
meanings.sent1: The festival will enrace various traditions from around the world.
meanings.sent2: Their family recipes enrace flavors from different countries.
meanings.sent3: The art exhibition enraced a beautiful mix of styles and influences.
meanings.sent4: Music has the power to enrace diverse melodies into a harmonious symphony.
meanings.sent5: The city's cultural center works to enrace diversity through art and performances.

meanings.definition: To give a sense of belonging or acceptance to someone.
meanings.sent1: The close-knit community always enraces newcomers with open arms.
meanings.sent2: Her supportive words enrace those who may feel out of place.
meanings.sent3: The team captain's pep talk enraced confidence in each player.
meanings.sent4: Nature has a way of enracing us with its peaceful presence.
meanings.sent5: The mentor's guidance helped enrace the student into the group seamlessly.
